description: Coined circa 1640, from dis- +â€Ž believe. Compare misbelieve.

verbs.description: disbelieve (third-person singular simple present disbelieves, present participle disbelieving, simple past and past participle disbelieved)

entries.meaning: To not believe; to exercise disbelief.
examples: If you disbelieve such people, then keep disbelieving them for as long as you live or want.

entries.meaning: To actively deny (a statement, opinion or perception).
examples: He chose to disbelieve the bad news as inconceivable.
